children.subject:
I am in 189 (with Shewchuk) and 127 (with Ranade + Bayen) right now (+ easy Econ class + 16 hr/week non class commitments) it takes up most of my time. The 127 psets are due weekly this semester, and 189 is biweekly, but balancing both of those continuous psets takes up most of my time - I would not have enjoyed adding another tech class with weekly psets on top of that (I took Stat140 spring 2017 and spent about 10 hours on each homework). I do like the combo of 189 + 127 - the material at least for the first third of the semester has nicely played off each other in terms of being like "oh I proved this result in the other class last week and now its in this class this week".

Additionally, it would be more beneficial to take Stat 140 BEFORE 189 (even if Shewchuk is teaching) - you want to become really comfortable with probability before you are required to use it in 189. To elaborate, HW2 with Shewchuk was a massive math review homework (took an incredibly long time to do) which had many probability problems that required you to be comfortable with expectation, variance, probability distributions etc, all of which are taught later in Stat140. 

Perhaps swap 186 and 140? (I have not taken 186 so cannot speak to courseload/difficulty)

history.content:
I was considering taking CS 162 + CS 186 + an upper div H/SS next semester. Would this schedule allow me to have a decent amount of free time for recruiting etc.? 

Also for Spring 20, would 189 (if taught by Shewchuk) + Stat 140 + EECS 127 be feasible? I heard from others taking 189 with Shewchuk this semester that Stat 140/EECS 126  + EECS 127 didn't need to be taken before this version of 189 (so far at least), hence the concurrent enrollment. If 189 is taught by Sahai that semester then I'm planning on swapping out 189 with 161 and taking 189 later.

Essentially, I'm trying to divide up the above 6 courses over the next 2 semesters, and was wondering what could be the best/most balanced way to do so, while favoring a slightly lighter workload over the Fall, and prioritizing core SWE classes over ML based ones.
history.subject: 162 + 186 + H/SS and 189 + Stat 140 + EECS 127?
